clinical_study.brief_title: Autologous Bone Marrow Mononuclear Stem Cell for Children Suffering From Liver Cirrhosis Due to Biliary Atresia
clinical_study.official_title: Outcomes of Autologous Bone Marrow Mononuclear Stem Cell (BMMC) Transplantation for Children Suffering From Liver Cirrhosis Due to Biliary Atresia After Kasai's Operation: An Open Label Uncontrolled Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Vinmec Research Institute of Stem Cell and Gene Technology

clinical_study.source: Vinmec Research Institute of Stem Cell and Gene Technology

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study was to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of autologous bone marrow mononuclear stem cell transplantation for Children Suffering from Liver Cirrhosis Due to Biliary Atresia

detailed_description.textblock: This study is ferformed to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of autologous bone marrow mononuclear stem cell transplantation in the management of Liver Cirrhosis Due to Biliary Atresia after Kasai's operation of 20 patients at Vinmec Research Institute of Stem Cell and Gene Technology, Hanoi, Vietnam from January 2017 to December 2018

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3, 6 months and 12 months after transplantation
primary_outcome.description: Using Bilirubin (total, direct and indirect) to measure the changes in cholestasis

primary_outcome.measure: Assess the changes in Liver function
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3, 6 months and 12 months after transplantation
primary_outcome.description: Using AST (Aspart transaminase) and ALT (Alanin transaminase) (units: U/L), GGT (Gamma GT) (units: UI/L), and Bilirubin (units: mg/dL) to measure the changes in Liver function

primary_outcome.measure: Assess the changes in level of cirrhosis
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3, 6 months and 12 months after transplantation
primary_outcome.description: Using PELD score (according to the suggestion of The Liver and Intestinal Organ Transplantation Committee in 2009). PELD is calculated based on three indicators: albumin (g / dL), bilirubin (units: mg / dL) and INR (international normalized ratio). Formula: PELD = 10 * (0.48 * ln(Serum Bilirubin) + 1.857 * ln(INR) - 0.687 * ln(Albumin) + (0.436 if patient is less than 1 year old) + (0.667 if patient has growth failure)). Evaluate the result: If PELD <10: good results If 10 <PELD <15: average results If PELD> 15: bad results

primary_outcome.measure: Assess the changes in liver biopsy
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3, 6 months and 12 months after transplantation
primary_outcome.description: Liver biopsy, in combination with history and physical examination data, is a powerful clinical tool for diagnosing and treating liver disease to evaluate the changes in liver biopsy

arm_group.description: Stem cell transplantations include 2 administrations of autologous bone marrow mononuclear cells via the hepatic artery at baseline and 6 months afterward

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children were diagnosed with Liver Cirrhosis Due to biliary atresia after Kasai's operation
- 1 year old or older
- Patients with manifestation of cirrhosis after Kasai's operation: hepatomegaly, congestive splenomegaly, elevated liver enzymes, Esophageal Varices (based on Endoscopic Diagnosis), cirrhosis (based on liver biopsy)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Under 1 year old patients
- Epilepsy
- Coagulation disorders
- Allergy to anesthetic agents
- Severe health conditions such as cancer, failure of heart, lung, liver or kidney
- Active infections
- Severe psychiatric disorders
